protocol_name: Measurement of fecal neutral sterol(FNS) excretion and fractional cholesterol absorption(FCA) using the dual fecal isotope method
protocol_name_html: Measurement of fecal neutral sterol(FNS) excretion and fractional cholesterol absorption(FCA) using the dual fecal isotope method
affiliation: University of Kentucky-Saha Cardiovascular Research center; Department of Pharmacology and Nutritional Sciences
manuscript_citation: Kim S, Yang L, Kim S, Lee RG, Graham MJ, Berliner JA, Lusis AJ, Cai L, Temel RE, Rateri DL, Lee S (2017) Targeting hepatic heparin-binding EGF-like growth factor (HB-EGF) induces anti-hyperlipidemia leading to reduction of angiotensin II-induced aneurysm development. PLoS ONE 12(8): e0182566. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0182566
keywords: fecal neutral sterol, FNS, excretion, fractional cholesterol absorption, FCA, dual fecal isotope,

components.data:
• A mixture containing 8mg of [26, 26, 26, 27, 27, 27-2H6] cholesterol, 8mg of [2, 2, 4, 4, 6-2H5] sitostanol was added to 4mL of vegetable oil in a 7mL scintillation vial (this solution requires vigorous stirring for over an hour  w/ stir bar before sterols are completely dissolved).
  • Using a stainless steel gavage needle attached to a 250µL Hamilton syringe; dose each mouse with 50µL of sterol mixture (when pulling mixture into syringe be sure to remove any bubbles).
  • After dosing the mouse, expel any unused mixture back into Eppendorf tube so as to avoid any unnecessary waste.

  • Mice are singly housed in wire bottom cages lined w/ paper towels for 72 hours with free access to food and water

  • After 72 hours, weigh mice and feces are collected (remove any food particles or paper towel that is attached to feces) and stored in 20mL scintillation vials in -20oC for further analysis.
  • Desiccate the feces by placing the vials into a vacuum oven set at 80°C, overnight.

  • Weigh the feces to determine the total fecal dry weight.

  • Once the feces are dried, they can be stored at room temp and processed at a later date.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• A mixture containing 8mg of [26, 26, 26, 27, 27, 27-2H6] cholesterol, 8mg of [2, 2, 4, 4, 6-2H5] sitostanol was added to 4mL of vegetable oil in a 7mL scintillation vial (this solution requires vigorous stirring for over an hour  w/ stir bar before sterols are completely dissolved).
  • Using a stainless steel gavage needle attached to a 250µL Hamilton syringe; dose each mouse with 50µL of sterol mixture (when pulling mixture into syringe be sure to remove any bubbles).
  • After dosing the mouse, expel any unused mixture back into Eppendorf tube so as to avoid any unnecessary waste.

  • Mice are singly housed in wire bottom cages lined w/ paper towels for 72 hours with free access to food and water

  • After 72 hours, weigh mice and feces are collected (remove any food particles or paper towel that is attached to feces) and stored in 20mL scintillation vials in -20oC for further analysis.
  • Desiccate the feces by placing the vials into a vacuum oven set at 80°C, overnight.

  • Weigh the feces to determine the total fecal dry weight.

  • Once the feces are dried, they can be stored at room temp and processed at a later date.

components.data:
• Using a mortar and pestle, crush the feces into a fine powder.  Wear a mask and lab coach during this process since the feces contain radioactivity.

  • Place ~100 µg 5-alpha cholestane into 16x100mm glass screw top tubes.  Dry off the solvent under N2 in the heating block.

  • Into the 16x100mm glass tubes, place ~100 mg of dried feces and record the exact weight.

  • Add 2 ml 95% EtOH and 200 µl 50% KOH to the tube.

  • Cap tube and incubate at ~60°C for 3 hrs with periodic vortexing.
  • Add 2 ml hexane and vortex.
  • Add 2 ml water and vortex.

  • Centrifuge the tube at 2,700 rpm for 10 min at room temp.

  • Transfer the upper hexane phase to a clean 4 mL vial and dry off solvent using N2.

  • Resuspend extract in 50-100µL of hexane and transfer to GC vial for analysis.
components.name: Description

  • Place ~100 µg 5-alpha cholestane into 16x100mm glass screw top tubes.  Dry off the solvent under N2 in the heating block.

  • Add 2 ml hexane and vortex.
  • Add 2 ml water and vortex.

  • Centrifuge the tube at 2,700 rpm for 10 min at room temp.

  • Transfer the upper hexane phase to a clean 4 mL vial and dry off solvent using N2.

  • Resuspend extract in 50-100µL of hexane and transfer to GC vial for analysis.
